content:
Do folks have strong opinions on label systems for issues?

Myself I like to just delete all the default labels and then add labels when there's enough issues to bother grouping them under a label.
There are a couple of standard ones in the Rust project worth keeping
I-nominated, C-tracking-issue, some of the A ones, like A-simd, that make it easy to keep track of the state of things across repos
I tend to just introduce them on-demand though :smile:
I put us down for I-nominated and C-tracking-issue; using A-simd seemed a little silly since the entire crate is simd.
...what do those prefix letters mean anyway?
It is, but when we track issues across repos it does make it easier to line up SIMD issues
fair point
It might only be worth adding to tracking issues though because I normally just try gather those together on our big Libs project board
I think some of them might just be to push labels down the list :big_smile:
A is area, T is team, C is... umm... like, yeh, and I is long bar
The prefixes are abbreviations, I think I is impact (what is impacted) E is effort
‚ÄúImpact‚Äù makes more sense than ‚ÄúLong Bar‚Äù
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-wiki-backup/blob/master/Note-tag-label-names-and-definitions.md
I found this page
Alright we've got three whole labels: https://github.com/rust-lang/stdsimd/labels
and also three tracking issues, one of which is at 4/5 boxes checked!
C -> Category
how do I modify labels? :weary:
I have tried a few things that seem like they would work but none of them actually do, I suspect I lack authorization.

Issues > labels >
Then you can make a new label or you can edit an existing label in the list.
But if you don't have permissions for that then just tell me what you want and i can do it
ah, I am looking at the project-portable-simd repo

Ah.

Not sure i'm a big fan of us having two repos honestly. Sounds confusing in the long run.
Maybe we should, in fact, not have two repos.
https://github.com/rust-lang/stdsimd/issues/9 :^)
Do you think HackMD + Zulip would be enough for us to work through RFCs with? If so then I'd be happy to turn that repo into a stub with some links? Just so it's easy to discover :grinning:
I think we should use a single repo until it makes sense for us to back out and split our work into multiple repos.
can issues be moved between repos, or should I just copy/paste?
they can be, i think.
Can the issues that I posted in project-portable-simd be moved then?
I think that if you have issue powers in two different repos you can move issues between those repos, but i've never done it myself.
@Ashley Mannix Oh yeah if you can move the issues over while stubbing out the repo that would be great and if some mysterious force prevents you then I will just do some copypasta.
I‚Äôll see if it will let me üôÇ
I popped out labels for specific ISA extensions.
( do they make sense? do my compatriots at least understand why I prefixed them with "ISA-"? <_< )
